alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Carroll; Chariton; Sullivan (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 8:47AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Missouri, including the following counties, Caldwell, Carroll, Chariton, Grundy, Linn MO, Livingston and Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.2 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen so far this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chillicothe, Brookfield, Carrollton, Marceline, Norborne, Bucklin, Meadville, Hale, Laclede, Bosworth, Linneus, Wheeling, Utica, Browning, Chula, Laredo, Purdin, Mendon, Bogard and Tina. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
